study_info.title: MEN2 phenotype in a family with germline heterozygous rare RET K666N variant presenting with pheochromocytoma, medullary thyroid microcarcinoma, and primary hyperparathyroidism
study_info.authors: A La Greca, D Dawes, M Albuja-Cruz, C Raeburn, L Axell, L Ku, C Klein, C Marshall, L Fishbein
study_info.study_type: Case report and family genetic analysis
study_info.study_focus: Clinical characterization of RET K666N heterozygous variant carriers in a family with MEN2-associated tumors
study_info.key_findings: RET K666N variant is pathogenic but low-penetrance, predilection for MTC, PHEO, PHPT in younger patients, variable phenotypic expression among carriers

patient_data.other_tumors/conditions: Toxic megacolon; Hyalinizing trabecular tumor (5 mm, right-sided) on thyroidectomy

imaging_findings.thyroid_nodules: None detected (initially); post-op trabecular tumor 5 mm

pathology_findings.thyroid_microcarcinoma: 4 mm medullary microcarcinoma, left lobe, no extrathyroidal extension
pathology_findings.lymph_node_metastasis: 1/13 nodes positive for metastatic microcarcinoma, tumor deposit 0.2 mm
pathology_findings.parathyroid_gland: Left inferior gland 0.1 g hypercellular tissue

surgical_treatments: Total colectomy and end ileostomy (for toxic megacolon)
Total thyroidectomy and partial parathyroidectomy (left inferior gland)
patient_data.clinical_course: Complicated perioperative course (cardiogenic shock, multi-organ failure, ileostomy, toxic megacolon, enteral feeding via PEG); full recovery, followed by adrenalectomy, biochemical remission, and later surgical cure of micro-MTC and parathyroid disease. Labs normalized post-op. Stable condition at 2-year follow-up.
patient_data.family_history: Father: Jaw tumor age 41. Mother: Graves’ disease. No family history otherwise of MEN2 features.
patient_data.patient_symptoms_and_perspective: Episodes described as 'surge running up towards her head' with palpitations, sweating, headache for 2 years. Retrospective narrative: anxiety, achy/heavy feet, night sweats, headaches (base of skull), hot flashes after showers/hot tubs. History of frequent UTIs before PHEO removal.

patient_data.other_tumors/conditions: Papillary thyroid cancer (PTC), multifocal classical type; metastatic deposits in lymph nodes; No MTC or C-cell hyperplasia.

imaging_findings.thyroid_nodules: Two: 5 mm and 11 mm, suspicious features
imaging_findings.left_neck_LN: Suspicious central and lateral neck lymph nodes
imaging_findings.FNA_findings: PTC and metastatic PTC in left level IV node

pathology_findings.thyroid: Multifocal PTC greatest dimension 0.8 cm, no angioinvasion or extra-thyroidal extension
pathology_findings.lymph_nodes: 8/47 positive for PTC, largest 0.4 cm, no extra-nodal extension (pT1aN1b AJCC 8th Ed.)
pathology_findings.no_MTC: No evidence of MTC or C-cell hyperplasia

surgical_treatments: Total thyroidectomy with central and left lateral neck dissection
patient_data.clinical_course: Post-op thyroglobulin <0.1 (with TgAb); continues on annual MEN2 surveillance
patient_data.family_history: Shares RET variant with proband, brother, and her own son.
patient_data.patient_symptoms_and_perspective: Concern about neck mass prompted workup.

patient_data.medullary_thyroid_carcinoma_present: NID (possible — not yet operated, persistently elevated calcitonin)
patient_data.clinical_course: Declined thyroidectomy; labs monitored every 4–6 months; 3 years of stable elevated calcitonin; no clinical MEN2 features.
patient_data.family_history: Shares RET variant; monitored for MEN2 features.

patient_data.clinical_course: No clinical or biochemical MEN2 features; annual follow-up.
patient_data.patient_symptoms_and_perspective: Elected for surveillance, not preventive surgery.
